question: 1. Given an undirected graph G with V vertices and E edges, the sum of the degrees of all vertices is _____.
2. Which of the following is an advantage of adjacency list representation over adjacency matrix representation of a graph?

answers.a: In adjacency list representation, space is saved for sparse graphs
answers.b: DFS and BSF can be done in O(V + E) time for adjacency list representation. These operations take O(V^2) time in adjacency matrix representation. Here, V and E are number of vertices and edges respectively
answers.c: Adding a vertex in adjacency list representation is easier than adjacency matrix representation

question: 3. Which of the following is true about linked list implementation of queue?

answers.a: In push operation, if new nodes are inserted at the beginning of linked list, then in pop operation, nodes must be removed from the end
answers.b: In push operation, if new nodes are inserted at the end, then in pop operation, nodes must be removed from the beginning

question: 4. What is the postcondition of enqueue?

answers.a: New item is at the front of the queue
answers.b: New item is at the middle of the queue
answers.c: New item is at the rear of the queue

question: 5. If the elements “A”, “B”, “C” and “D” are placed in a queue and are deleted one at a time, in what order will they be removed?
6. How many queues are needed to implement a stack? Consider the situation where no other data structure like arrays, linked list is available to you.
7. How many undirected graphs (not necessarily connected) can be constructed out of a given set V= {V 1, V 2,…V n} of n vertices?

8. Which of the following statements is/are TRUE for an undirected graph?
P: Number of odd degree vertices is even.
Q: Sum of degrees of all vertices is even.
9. Which of the following operations is not O(1) for an array of sorted data? You may assume that array elements are distinct.
